threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE TA582 CnC Checkin"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:".php?id="; content:"&key="; distance:0; content:"&s=mints"; distance:0; fast_pattern; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell"; http.host; content:".top"; pcre:"/[a-n]{15}\.top/W"; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2057741; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2024_04_16, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Critical, tag TA582, updated_at 2024_11_21, former_sid 2856654;)

alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE TA582 CnC Checkin"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:"|2e|php|3f|s|3d|mints"; fast_pattern; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell"; http.host; content:"|2e|top"; endswith; reference:md5,e8da759e748db6eab355cf87d1f2db6c; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2057743; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_09_04, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Critical, tag c2, tag TA582, updated_at 2024_11_21, former_sid 2858291, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO HTTP Request to a *.top domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO HTTP Request to a *.top domain"; flow:established,to_server; threshold:type limit, track by_src, count 1, seconds 30; http.host; content:".top"; fast_pattern; pcre:"/^(\x3a\d{1,5})?$/R"; reference:url,www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/shady-tld-research-gdn-and-our-2016-wrap; reference:url,www.spamhaus.org/statistics/tlds/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2023882; rev:5; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2017_02_07, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_21;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET DNS Query to a *.top domain - Likely Hostile
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET DNS Query to a *.top domain - Likely Hostile"; threshold:type limit, track by_src, count 1, seconds 30; dns.query; content:".top"; nocase; endswith; reference:url,www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/shady-tld-research-gdn-and-our-2016-wrap; reference:url,www.spamhaus.org/statistics/tlds/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2023883; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2017_02_07, deployment Perimeter, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2020_09_15;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

alert udp $HOME_NET any -> any 53 ( msg:"INDICATOR-COMPROMISE Suspicious .top dns query"; flow:to_server; byte_test:1,!&,0xF8,2; content:"|03|top|00|",fast_pattern,nocase; service:dns; reference:url,en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.top; classtype:misc-activity; gid:1; sid:43687; rev:3; )

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a file ending in jse, vbe, js, vba, vbs written by cscript.exe or wscript.exe

@{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\vakynh.js; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=443; DestinationIp=45.11.180.77; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=172.16.1.3; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=52023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=true; DestinationPort=53; Initiated=true; Protocol=udp; SourceIp=c0a8:20d:100:0:2881:2fda:82:ffff; DestinationIsIpv6=true; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; SourcePort=61832; DestinationIp=808:808:0:0:0:0:0:0}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Alias Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Set-Alias or New-Alias cmdlet usage. Which can be use as a mean to obfuscate PowerShell scripts
